medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began one week prior to ERCP with bilateral lower quadrant cramping, attributed to chronic constipation. After the procedure, the patient experienced immediate epigastric pain that worsened and spread to bilateral lower quadrants. Associated symptoms included nausea and dry heaves, which improved with zofran. Pain was worsened by movement. Patient took percocet for pain, which was not effective.
medical_history.family_history: Father on hemodialysis, mother just started dialysis, oldest daughter has unspecified condition, cousin with unspecified disease, another maternal cousin has colitis and unspecified disease.
